001package gust.backend.model;
002
003import com.google.protobuf.Message;
004import com.google.protobuf.TypeRegistry;
005import com.google.protobuf.util.JsonFormat;
006import gust.backend.runtime.Logging;
007import org.slf4j.Logger;
008
009import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
010import javax.annotation.Nullable;
011import javax.annotation.concurrent.Immutable;
012import javax.annotation.concurrent.ThreadSafe;
013import java.io.IOException;
014import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
015import java.util.Objects;
016import java.util.Optional;
017
018
019/**
020 * Defines a {@link ModelCodec} which uses Protobuf serialization to export and import protos to and from from raw
021 * byte-strings. These formats are built into Protobuf and are considered extremely reliable, even across languages.
022 *
023 * <p>Two formats of Protobuf serialization are supported:
024 * <ul>
025 *   <li><b>Binary:</b> Most efficient format. Best for production use. Completely illegible to humans.</li>
026 *   <li><b>ProtoJSON:</b> Protocol Buffers-defined JSON translation protocol.</li>
027 * </ul></p>
028 *
029 * @see ModelCodec Generic model codec interface.
030 */
031@Immutable
032@ThreadSafe
033public final class ProtoModelCodec<Model extends Message> implements ModelCodec<Model, EncodedModel> {
034  /** Default wire format mode. */
035  private static final EncodingMode DEFAULT_FORMAT = EncodingMode.BINARY;
036
037  /** Log pipe to use. */
038  private static final Logger logging = Logging.logger(ProtoModelCodec.class);
039
040  /** Protobuf wire format to use. */
041  private final EncodingMode wireMode;
042
043  /** Builder from which to spawn models. */
044  private final Model instance;
045
046  /** JSON printer utility, initialized when operating with `wireMode=JSON`. */
047  private final @Nullable JsonFormat.Printer jsonPrinter;
048
049  /** JSON parser utility, initialized when operating with `wireMode=JSON`. */
050  private final @Nullable JsonFormat.Parser jsonParser;
051
052  /** Serializer object. */
053  private final @Nonnull ModelSerializer<Model, EncodedModel> serializer;
054
055  /** De-serializer object. */
056  private final @Nonnull ModelDeserializer<EncodedModel, Model> deserializer;
057
058  /**
059   * Private constructor. Use static factory methods.
060   *
061   * @see #forModel(Message) To spawn a proto-codec for a given model.
062   * @param instance Model instance (empty) to use for type information.
063   * @param mode Mode to apply to this codec instance.
064   * @param registry Optional type registry of other types to use with {@link JsonFormat}.
065   */
066  private ProtoModelCodec(@Nonnull Model instance, @Nonnull EncodingMode mode, @Nullable TypeRegistry registry) {
067    this.wireMode = mode;
068    this.instance = instance;
069    this.serializer = new ProtoMessageSerializer();
070    this.deserializer = new ProtoMessageDeserializer();
071
072    if (logging.isTraceEnabled())
073      logging.trace(String.format("Initializing `ProtoModelCodec` with format %s.", mode.name()));
074
075    if (mode == EncodingMode.JSON) {
076      TypeRegistry resolvedRegisry = registry != null ? registry : TypeRegistry.newBuilder()
077        .add(instance.getDescriptorForType())
078        .build();
079
080      this.jsonParser = JsonFormat.parser()
081        .usingTypeRegistry(resolvedRegisry);
082
083      this.jsonPrinter = JsonFormat.printer()
084        .usingTypeRegistry(resolvedRegisry)
085        .sortingMapKeys()
086        .omittingInsignificantWhitespace();
087
088    } else {
089      this.jsonParser = null;
090      this.jsonPrinter = null;
091    }
092  }
093
094  // -- Factories -- //
095
096  /**
097   * Acquire a Protobuf model codec for the provided model instance. The codec will operate in the default
098   * {@link EncodingMode} unless specified otherwise via the other method variants on this object.
099   *
100   * @param <M> Model instance type.
101   * @param instance Model instance to return a codec for.
102   * @return Model codec which serializes and de-serializes to/from Protobuf wire formats.
103   */
104  @SuppressWarnings({"WeakerAccess", "unused"})
105  public @Nonnull static <M extends Message> ProtoModelCodec<M> forModel(@Nonnull M instance) {
106    return forModel(instance, DEFAULT_FORMAT);
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Acquire a Protobuf model codec for the provided model instance. The codec will operate in the default
111   * {@link EncodingMode} unless specified otherwise via the other method variants on this object.
112   *
113   * @param <M> Model instance type.
114   * @param instance Model instance to return a codec for.
115   * @param mode Wire format mode to operate in (one of {@code JSON} or {@code BINARY}).
116   * @return Model codec which serializes and de-serializes to/from Protobuf wire formats.
117   */
118  public @Nonnull static <M extends Message> ProtoModelCodec<M> forModel(@Nonnull M instance,
119                                                                         @Nonnull EncodingMode mode) {
120    return forModel(instance, mode, Optional.empty());
121  }
122
123  /**
124   * Acquire a Protobuf model codec for the provided model instance. The codec will operate in the default
125   * {@link EncodingMode} unless specified otherwise via the other method variants on this object.
126   *
127   * @param <M> Model instance type.
128   * @param instance Model instance to return a codec for.
129   * @param mode Wire format mode to operate in (one of {@code JSON} or {@code BINARY}).
130   * @return Model codec which serializes and de-serializes to/from Protobuf wire formats.
131   */
132  @SuppressWarnings("WeakerAccess")
133  public @Nonnull static <M extends Message> ProtoModelCodec<M> forModel(@Nonnull M instance,
134                                                                         @Nonnull EncodingMode mode,
135                                                                         @Nonnull Optional<TypeRegistry> registry) {
136    return new ProtoModelCodec<>(
137      instance,
138      mode,
139      registry.orElse(null));
140  }
141
142  /** Serializes model instances into raw bytes, according to Protobuf wire protocol semantics. */
143  private final class ProtoMessageSerializer implements ModelSerializer<Model, EncodedModel> {
144    /**
145     * Serialize a model instance from the provided object type to the specified output type, throwing exceptions
146     * verbosely if we are unable to correctly, verifiably, and properly export the record.
147     *
148     * @param input Input record object to serialize.
149     * @return Serialized record data, of the specified output type.
150     * @throws ModelDeflateException If the model fails to export or serialize for any reason.
151     */
152    @Override
153    public @Nonnull EncodedModel deflate(@Nonnull Message input) throws ModelDeflateException, IOException {
154      if (logging.isDebugEnabled())
155        logging.debug(String.format(
156          "Deflating record of type '%s' with format %s.",
157          input.getDescriptorForType().getFullName(),
158          wireMode.name()));
159
160      if (wireMode == EncodingMode.BINARY) {
161        return EncodedModel.wrap(
162          input.getDescriptorForType().getFullName(),
163          wireMode,
164          input.toByteArray());
165      } else {
166        return EncodedModel.wrap(
167          input.getDescriptorForType().getFullName(),
168          wireMode,
169          Objects.requireNonNull(jsonPrinter).print(input).getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
170      }
171    }
172  }
173
174  /** De-serializes model instances from raw bytes, according to Protobuf wire protocol semantics. */
175  private final class ProtoMessageDeserializer implements ModelDeserializer<EncodedModel, Model> {
176    /**
177     * De-serialize a model instance from the provided input type, throwing exceptions verbosely if we are unable to
178     * correctly, verifiably, and properly load the record.
179     *
180     * @param data Input data or object from which to load the model instance.
181     * @return De-serialized and inflated model instance. Always a {@link Message}.
182     * @throws ModelInflateException If the model fails to load for any reason.
183     */
184    @Override
185    public @Nonnull Model inflate(@Nonnull EncodedModel data) throws ModelInflateException, IOException {
186      if (logging.isDebugEnabled())
187        logging.debug(String.format(
188          "Inflating record of type '%s' with format %s.",
189          data.getType(),
190          wireMode.name()));
191
192      if (wireMode == EncodingMode.BINARY) {
193        //noinspection unchecked
194        return (Model)instance.newBuilderForType().mergeFrom(data.getRawBytes().toByteArray()).build();
195      } else {
196        Message.Builder builder = instance.newBuilderForType();
197        Objects.requireNonNull(jsonParser).merge(
198          data.getRawBytes().toStringUtf8(),
199          builder);
200
201        //noinspection unchecked
202        return (Model)builder.build();  // need to install proto JSON
203      }
204    }
205  }
206
207  // -- API: Codec -- //
208  /**
209   * Acquire an instance of the {@link ModelSerializer} attached to this adapter. The instance is not guaranteed to be
210   * created fresh for this invocation.
211   *
212   * @return Serializer instance.
213   * @see #deserializer() For the inverse of this method.
214   * @see #deserialize(Object) To call into de-serialization directly.
215   */
216  @Override
217  public @Nonnull ModelSerializer<Model, EncodedModel> serializer() {
218    return this.serializer;
219  }
220
221  /**
222   * Acquire an instance of the {@link ModelDeserializer} attached to this adapter. The instance is not guaranteed to be
223   * created fresh for this invocation.
224   *
225   * @return Deserializer instance.
226   * @see #serializer() For the inverse of this method.
227   * @see #serialize(Message) To call into serialization directly.
228   */
229  @Override
230  public @Nonnull ModelDeserializer<EncodedModel, Model> deserializer() {
231    return this.deserializer;
232  }
233}
